ax-basic-tokens.html.title: Basic Design Tokens
ax-basic-tokens.html.contents: Basic Design Tokens This token list is inspired by Pollen CSS. Typography Related Pollen [external] Modular Scale Major third, equal-tempered: ∛2 ≅ 1.26 Related Pollen [external] https://www.modularscale.com/?1&em&2@3 [external] Line Height Line heights supporting the vertical rhythm at every step of the scale. Related Pollen [external] https://drewish.com/tools/vertical-rhythm/ [external] :root scss :root { --font-sans: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif; --font-serif: "Source Serif Pro", serif; --font-mono: "Source Code Pro", monospace; } Font Families Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --weight-light: 300; --weight-regular: 400; --weight-medium: 500; --weight-semibold: 600; --weight-bold: 700; --weight-extrabold: 800; --weight-black: 900; } Font Weights Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --letter-xs: -0.05em; --letter-sm: -0.025em; --letter-none: 0em; --letter-lg: 0.025em; --letter-xl: 0.05em; } Letter Spacing Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --prose-xs: 24ch; --prose-sm: 30ch; --prose-md: 42ch; --prose-lg: 60ch; --prose-xl: 84ch; } Prose Width Related Pollen [external] Layout Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { @for $i from 1 through 16 { --size-#{$i}: calc(#{0.25 * $i} * var(--line-root-abs)); } --size-full: 100%; --size-screen: 100vw; --size-min: min-content; --size-max: max-content; } Sizes Scale Related Pollen [external] $width-xs scss $width-xs: 30rem; Container Widths Related Pollen [external] https://bholmes.dev/blog/alternative-to-css-variable-media-queries/ [external] UI Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { @for $i from 1 through 8 { --stroke-#{$i}: #{0.0625 * $i}rem; } } Strokes Scale A scale of stroke widths in steps of 1/16 rem. :root scss :root { --radius-100: 100%; --radius-xs: 0.2rem; --radius-sm: 0.4rem; --radius-md: 0.6rem; --radius-lg: 0.8rem; --radius-xl: 1rem; --radius-full: 999rem; } Radius Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --blur-xs: blur(0.333rem); --blur-sm: blur(0.577rem); --blur-md: blur(1rem); --blur-lg: blur(1.732rem); --blur-xl: blur(3rem); } Blur (Backdrop Filters) Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --layer-1: 10; --layer-2: 20; --layer-3: 30; --layer-4: 40; --layer-5: 50; --layer-below: -1; --layer-top: 2147483647; } Layers Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --elevation-1: 0 0.0625rem 0.125rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); --elevation-2: 0 0.0625rem 0.1875rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.0625rem 0.125rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06); --elevation-3: 0 0.25rem 0.375rem -0.125rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.125rem 0.25rem -0.125rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06); --elevation-4: 0 0.75rem 1rem -0.25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.25rem 0.375rem -0.125rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); --elevation-5: 0 1.25rem 1.5rem -0.25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.5rem 0.5rem -0.25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.04); --elevation-6: 0 1.5rem 3rem -0.75rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25); --elevation-7: 0 2rem 4rem -0.75rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); } Elevation (Drop Shadows) Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --easing-standard: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); --easing-accelerate: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 1, 1); --easing-decelerate: cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.2, 1); } Easing (Transition Curves) Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --color-grey-50: #f9fafb; --color-grey-100: #f2f4f5; --color-grey-200: #e8eaed; --color-grey-300: #d4d7dd; --color-grey-400: #a5aab4; --color-grey-500: #767c89; --color-grey-600: #555d6e; --color-grey-700: #3f4754; --color-grey-800: #2c343f; --color-grey-900: #10181c; --color-black: #14141b; --color-grey: var(--color-grey-500); --color-red-300: #fc8181; --color-red-500: #e53e3e; --color-red-700: #c53030; --color-red: var(--color-red-500); --color-green-300: #9ae6b4; --color-green-500: #48bb78; --color-green-700: #2f855a; --color-green: var(--color-green-500); --color-blue-300: #63b3ed; --color-blue-500: #4299e1; --color-blue-700: #3182ce; --color-blue: var(--color-blue-500); --color-pink-300: #fbb6ce; --color-pink-500: #ed64a6; --color-pink-700: #d53f8c; --color-pink: var(--color-pink-500); --color-purple-300: #b794f4; --color-purple-500: #805ad5; --color-purple-700: #6b46c1; --color-purple: var(--color-purple-500); --color-teal-300: #81e6d9; --color-teal-500: #38b2ac; --color-teal-700: #2c7a7b; --color-teal: var(--color-teal-500); --color-yellow-300: #faf089; --color-yellow-500: #ecc94b; --color-yellow-700: #d69e2e; --color-yellow: var(--color-yellow-500); --color-orange-300: #fbd38d; --color-orange-500: #ed8936; --color-orange-700: #dd6b20; --color-orange: var(--color-orange-500); --color-brown-300: #a1887f; --color-brown-500: #795548; --color-brown-700: #5d4037; --color-brown: var(--color-brown-500); } Color Palette Related Pollen [external] Grid Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --grid-2: repeat(2, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-3: repeat(3, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-4: repeat(4, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-5: repeat(5, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-6: repeat(6, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-7: repeat(7, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-8: repeat(8, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-9: repeat(9, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-10: repeat(10, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-11: repeat(11, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-12: repeat(12, minmax(0, 1fr)); } Grid Template Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --grid-page-width: var(--width-xl); --grid-page-gutter: 5vw; --grid-page-main: 2 / 3; --grid-page: minmax(var(--grid-page-gutter), 1fr) minmax(0, var(--grid-page-width)) minmax(var(--grid-page-gutter), 1fr); } Page Grid Related Pollen [external]

ax-logical-tokens.html.title: Logical Design Tokens
ax-logical-tokens.html.contents: Logical Design Tokens :root scss :root { --font-body: var(--font-serif); --font-heading: var(--font-sans); --weight-body: var(--weight-normal); --weight-emphasis: var(--weight-bold); --weight-heading: var(--weight-bold); --color-body: var(--color-black); --color-body-inverted: var(--color-grey-50); --color-primary: var(--color-purple); --color-primary-light: var(--color-purple-300); --color-primary-dark: var(--color-purple-700); --color-heading: var(--color-grey-700); --color-links: var(--color-primary-dark); --color-links-inverted: var(--color-primary-light); --color-hr: var(--color-primary); --spacing-block: var(--line-root-abs); --spacing-block-heading: var(--spacing-block); --spacing-sectioning: var(--spacing-block); --spacing-inline: calc(1.5 * var(--line-root-abs)); --stroke-table: var(--stroke-2); --stroke-hr: var(--stroke-2); } Globally available tokens. More space on large screens.

el-document.html.title: Unique Document Elements
el-document.html.contents: Unique Document Elements These elements are unique to each document. Some of the selectors are not pure element selectors. But due to their uniqueness it makes sense to address them without any added class specificity. :root scss :root { font-size: var(--scale-root, 100%); } Document root. Equivalent to html. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] body scss body { color: var(--color-body); // Push down the footer. min-block-size: 100vh; } Sectioning root. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] main:not([hidden]) scss main:not([hidden]) { } The document’s main content. There can be only one. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] :where(body, body > div) > header:first-of-type scss :where(body, body > div) > header:first-of-type { } The document’s main header. :where(body, body > div) > footer:last-of-type scss :where(body, body > div) > footer:last-of-type { // Clever sticky footer (https://css-tricks.com/a-clever-sticky-footer-technique/) position: sticky; inset-block-start: 100vh; // Spacing and color. padding-block: var(--size-8); color: var(--color-body-inverted); background: var(--color-grey-700); a:any-link { color: var(--color-links-inverted); } } The document’s main footer. :target scss :target { // Give URL fragment target enough air. scroll-margin-block-start: var(--size-12); } The current target element.

el-edits.html.title: Demarcating Edits
el-edits.html.contents: Demarcating Edits The ins and del elements represent edits to the document. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] del scss del { background: var(--color-red-300); } Deletion. ins scss ins { background: var(--color-green-300); } Insertion.

el-embedding.html.title: Embedding
el-embedding.html.contents: Embedding Multimedia Content No default styles needed. picture {} source {} img {} video {} audio {} track {} map {} area {} Related Spec (images) [external] Spec (embedded content) [external] Spec (media) [external] Spec (image maps) [external] MDN [external] Embedding Containers No default styles needed. embed {} iframe {} object {} portal {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external] Embedded Fragments of Other Markup Languages No default styles needed. svg {} math {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external]

el-forms.html.title: Form-associated Content
el-forms.html.contents: Form-associated Content These are elements which can be used together to create forms which the user can fill out and submit to the web site or application. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] form scss form { } Form. Submission button scss button { } Button. Labeling & Grouping label scss label { } Label. fieldset scss fieldset { } Fieldset. legend scss legend { } Legend. Value Lists datalist scss datalist { } Datalist. option scss option { } Option. optgroup scss optgroup { } Optgroup. Inputs input scss input { } Input. textarea scss textarea { } Textarea. select scss select { } Select. Outputs meter scss meter { } Meter. output scss output { } Output. progress scss progress { } Progress.

el-interactive.html.title: Interactive Elements
el-interactive.html.contents: Interactive Elements These elements help to create interactive user interface objects. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] details scss details { } Details. The details element represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls. summary scss summary { } Summary. The summary element represents a summary, caption, or legend for the rest of the contents of the summary element’s parent details element, if any. dialog scss dialog { } Dialog. The dialog element represents a part of an application that a user interacts with to perform a task, for example a dialog box, inspector, or window.

el-scripting.html.title: Scripting
el-scripting.html.contents: Scripting Scripts allow authors to add interactivity to their documents. Elements dedicated to scripting normally do not require styling. script {} noscript {} canvas {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external]

el-sectioning.html.title: Sectioning
el-sectioning.html.contents: Sectioning Sections :is(article, section) scss :is(article, section) { gap: var(--spacing-sectioning); margin-block: var(--spacing-sectioning); &> :is(h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, p, ol, ul, dl):first-child { margin-block-start: 0; } &> :is(h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, p, ol, ul, dl):last-child { margin-block-end: 0; } * { gap: inherit; } } Let sections control the block spacing. Heading Content Sectioning Scope Specific Elements

el-tables.html.title: Tabular Content
el-tables.html.contents: Tabular Content The elements here are used to create and handle tabular data (data with more than one dimension). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] table scss table { --table-border-width: 0; border-collapse: collapse; padding: 0; border-spacing: 0; } The table itself. caption scss caption { } Table caption. thead scss thead { } Table header. tbody scss tbody { } Table body. tfoot scss tfoot { } Table footer. tr scss tr { } Table row. td, th scss td, th { padding: calc(0.5 * (var(--line-root-abs) - var(--table-border-width))); } Table cells.

el-text.html.title: Text Content
el-text.html.contents: Text Content Block-level Text Content Generic block div { /* Don’t style the generic block! */ } Paragraph Thematic break List Definition list Extended quotation Self-contained figure Preformatted text Inline Text Semantics Generic range span { /* Don’t style the generic range! */ } Line Breaks Links Emphasis Terminology Inline Quotation Citation Altered Baseline Input/Output Inline Code Data Enhanced Semantics Directionality Ruby

ge-normalize.html.title: Normalizing
ge-normalize.html.contents: normalize.css Stylament uses normalize.css for normalizing browser styling. Related Repo [external]

ge-slots.html.title: Preparing Slots
ge-slots.html.contents: n’ize.css Stylament uses n’ize.css to extend basic styling with slots for CSS custom properties. Related Repo [external]

index.html.title: Stylament Documentation
index.html.contents: Stylament A fundament for your document styling. This is gonna be solid. And flexible. At the same time. Awesome!

ob-navigation.html.title: Navigation
ob-navigation.html.contents: Navigation Menu Common patterns for navigation menus. Separated into several aspects. $nav-wide scss $nav-wide: widths.$width-sm; Breakpoint for switching to wide layout. $size scss $size: 2em; Size factor of the menu. nav.menu scss nav.menu { position: relative; & .--toggle-state, & .--toggle-face { display: none; } } General navigation menu. This is the basic selector with the basic rules applied. nav.menu.levelable scss nav.menu.levelable { & > menu { display: block; & > li { display: block; text-align: start; } // Horizontal nav on wider screen. @media (min-width: $nav-wide) { display: flex; & > li { flex: 1; text-align: center; } } } } Levelable Nav. Places items on a horizontal level if enough space is available. nav.menu.foldable scss nav.menu.foldable { --toggle-face-size: #{$size}; --inset-start: var(--toggle-face-size); --inset-end: 0; & > label { & > .--toggle-face { display: inline-block; position: absolute; inset-block-start: 0; inset-inline-start: 0; inline-size: var(--toggle-face-size); block-size: var(--toggle-face-size); padding: var(--toggle-face-padding); transition: all 0.3s var(--easing-standard); & > img { block-size: 100%; } } } & > menu { position: absolute; inset-block-start: 0; inset-inline-start: var(--inset-start); inset-inline-end: var(--inset-end); overflow: hidden; transition: inset-inline-end 0.3s var(--easing-standard); } @media (max-width: calc($nav-wide - 1px)) { // Backdrop when unfolded on small screen. & input.--toggle-state:checked ~ label { position: absolute; inset: 0; inline-size: 100vw; block-size: 100vh; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5); } & input.--toggle-state:not(:checked) { & ~ menu { inset-inline-end: 100%; } & ~ label > .--toggle-face { @include toggle-face-folded; } } } @media (min-width: $nav-wide) { & input.--toggle-state:checked { & ~ menu { inset-inline-end: 100%; } & ~ label > .--toggle-face { @include toggle-face-folded; } } } } Foldable Nav. Allows to toggle the display of the menu. nav.menu.sticky scss nav.menu.sticky { position: sticky; inset-block-start: 0; block-size: $size; menu { --item-height: #{$size}; } } Sticky Nav. Makes navbar stick to the top of the viewport. Main Navigation Bar Rather opinonated styling for the first nav.menu. body > nav.menu:first-of-type scss body > nav.menu:first-of-type { $size: var(--size-8); --toggle-face-size: #{$size}; --toggle-face-padding: var(--size-1); --toggle-face-folded-background: white; --toggle-face-folded-radius: 0 0 var(--radius-lg); --toggle-face-folded-shadow: var(--elevation-5); height: $size; & > label > .--toggle-face { background: white; box-shadow: var(--elevation-3); } & > menu { --item-height: #{$size}; --item-line-height: var(--size-3); --item-padding: var(--size-3); box-shadow: var(--elevation-3); & > li { color: var(--color-body-inverted); background-color: var(--color-grey-700); transition: all 0.3s var(--easing-standard); &:hover { color: var(--color-grey-700); background-color: var(--color-body-inverted); } & > a { color: inherit; background-color: transparent; font-weight: var(--weight-bold); text-decoration: none; } } } } The first nav.menu is implicitly considered the main menu.

ob-special.html.title: More Specific Styling
ob-special.html.contents: Homepage Header body.homepage > header scss body.homepage > header { padding: var(--size-8) 0; color: var(--color-grey-900); background: var(--color-grey-50); text-align: center; & > * { background: white; border-radius: var(--radius-md); box-shadow: var(--elevation-6); } // Any image alone in an hgroup row is considered a logo. hgroup > * > img:only-child { // Size it so that it nicely fits the viewport. max-inline-size: 66vmin; max-block-size: 66vmin; } } Special homepage header styles.
